phrase.item: There once was an old woman and her grandson.
They had nothing to eat.
She said to her grandson: "Hey grandson!
Up until now I've provided you with your food, now [you] do it, you are big now."
He said: "Grandmother!
I will not go to work during the day, teach me the trade that my father knew and I will excercise (practice) it."
She said: "Your father had a trap, he would place it near the Source of Desires; birds would land on it, drink water;[and] he would trap them with his lace (loop/string) and bring them back.
We would eat a part and he would bring a part and sell it given that we had enough to live."

He said: "Grandmother, give me a string, I will place near the Source of Desires and I will catch something." The old woman gave him a string, and he went to place it near the Source of Desires, sat there until night and caught nothing.
In the evening, he came home empty handed. The old woman said: "Why did you come back empty handed?"
He responded: "Grandmother!
The trap caught nothing.
Tomorrow I will put it out again."

He went out, set up the trap; the birds, who that day had flown to the Source of Desires to drink from it, thought: "If we don't drink at the source we will fly away without having fulfilled the wishes, but if we quench our thirst, we will be caught in the trap of this terrestrial man."
They said: "Let's go, quench our thirst so as not to leave without having fulfilled the wishes."
They drank some water and all were caught in the trap.
He cut off their heads, [and] filled a sac to the brim, hoisted it up on his back and set off.
His grandmother said to him: "What are you doing?"
He responded: "Grandmother, today all of the birds that were there, landed.
I sliced all of their heads off!"
She said: "Grandson, you acted poorly.
You should have let some go, you could have caught some another time
but this way, nect time what will you get?"
He said: "Grandmother, you didn't tell me this right away (before) and now I've already slaughtered them."
Some time passed; one day they found themselves once again in a difficult situation.

Once again he took his lace (loop/string) to the source, [and] once again he placed it near the source, sat there until dusk and no one appeared. He was very annoyed and saddened and thought: "Well I'll wait just one hour more."
He sat there for another hour. A small bird appeared, very beautiful.
This small bird said: "If I drink from this source, I will be caught in your trap, if I don't drink, I will have flown away without satisfying the desires. Until I satisfy the desires,
I will not take flight."

He drank water, [and] got caught in the trap, the grandson of this old lady got him [the small bird] and it was a very beautiful little bird! He took it, brought it back to the house, said: "Grandmother, I caught nothing except this little bird."
They kept it for a few days, but one day when hunger took over they took the bird to slaughter it.
It said: "Hey grandson of the old woman!"
If you slaughter me I will not satiate you, bring me to the market, my price is of one hundred rupees.
He brought it to the market, tradespeople began to admire it, asking: "What is its price?"
He responded: "One hundred rupees."
Some tradespeople slapped him.
Another merchant hailed him over,
bought it for ne hundred rupees, [and] brought it to the king's son. The prince bought it for a thousand rupees and gave the merchant a royal garment.
The prince put him in a cage and kept him for a while.
One day in a dream the prince saw a Peri (winged fairy-like spirits ranking between angels and evil spirits) and in his heart felt a pain that never subsided.
The king said to him: "My son, what happened to you?"
The son said: "I saw a Peri in my dream."
The king responded: "I see her in my dream since childhood and I couldn't find her.
Come here!
Today, on this Friday,
go to the market, a Qalandar will appear.
A Qalandar will appear accompanied by a red mare with a white head.
Buy her for one hundred rupees, she'll have a winged foal in her belly.
After having bought her,
take care of her for forty days, have a good groom for her; have him keep a lit oil lamp near her so that, once she gives birth, the madmen won't take the foal away.
Once forty days have passsed (once the foal is born), do not let the foal fall to the ground, hold it in the air so that its wings do not break.
Keep him suspended (off the ground) for forty days and have him nurse from his mother; after forty days put him down and let him suckle milk from his mother for another forty days.
After forty days get on him [the foal], me in front and you behind me, together we'll fly to the Peri."
The prince went to the market and sat there until the evening, but nothing appeared. He thought: "The words of the bird proved false."
He was leaving the market when the Qalandar, yelling loudly, appeared with his mare.
The prince turned back, took her by the bridle and lead her back, brought the Qalandar with him and received (welcomed) him with great honor
In the morning the prince got up, brought the horse with a silver harness, clothes, one hundred rupees extra, and on top of that he offered all of this to the Qalandar.
He said: "Hey Qalandar!
Give me your mare!"
The Qalandar was overjoyed, [and] gave him his mare.
The Qalandar left hastily and hid in case the prince were to repent.
The prince took the mare and tied her up in the stable.
The prince hired a groom for her who took care of this mare day and night.
The mare lived like this for forty days,
Once forty days passed, the little bird said: "Hey prince!"
Watch over her tonight , she will birth the foal tonight; the madmen are on high alert and saying: "We will steal it [the foal]"
Do not let the foal fall on the ground, he has wings, his wings will break.
After that for forty days don't let him touch the ground, if not his wings will break, and next let him down for another forty days and in another forty days, we will go.

The prince was taking care of the foal for forty days. The sparrow told him, "Now come, the forty days are finished. Let me be in front of you, and you ride the horse with wings and follow me. I will take you to Qof mountain, to a fairy."
The prince got ready, the sparrow was ahead, the prince was riding the horse with wings after her and she took him to fairy.
The fairy had a park.
The sparrow took the prince there and hid him there.
And she went to fairy.
The fairy asks her, "Hey, sparrow, you disappeared!"
"Did you bring the prince with you?"
The sparrow said, " A person from soil has been really unfair!"

I went to the spring of desire to drink water, but there was a loop and I said, "If I don't frink water fron the wishes spring, my wishes won't come true, but if I drink the water, I will be stuck in the loop".
I said, "I leave it to God, I will dring from this spring of wishes that wy wishes will come true".
"I was drinking water and got stuck in the loop".
"A human from soil took me, he took care of me for one-two days, in fact he was poor".
"One day he cought me and wanted to slaughter me, I told him, "Hey, grandson of an old woman!",
"I won't make you full, you take me to the market and sell me, hundred rupi will be my prise".
"You bring that it will be four meals, but if you slaughter me, I won't make you happy".
"He took me to the market and sold me for hundred rupee to an owner of the market."
The prince has seen you in his dream. became trade.
I asked him,"What dream did you see?"
He said, "I sow fairy in dream that now I go to the fairy to mountain of Qof".
I told him that that you dead body even won't get there.
I tod him that, "You go to the market and stay till evening, in the evening a mystic will appear, he has a _______."
"It has a foal in its belly. That foal has wings.",
You buy that from the mystic, take care of it for forty days, after forty days it will give birth to the foal.
When the foal is delivered, don't put on the ground for forty days.
After forty days you will ride the horse with wings and I will take you to the princess, will take you to the fairy."
The fairy king's daughter told to the sparrow, "The prince I saw in my dream, now you brought that one?"
The sparrow said, "I brought him with the horse with wings and hid it in your park".
The fairy says,"Now, how I am going to find him?"
The sparrow said, "It is up to you".
She says,"Hey, sparrow you know better!"
Thesparrow said, "Now you make (write) a letter to your father that a soil human came on your name, that to take him as a guard for the left side gate",
"When he will be taken as a guard for the lest side of the gate, pull this side devil, the human from soil will be enough as a gate guard".
The prince was brought from the park, and took him her left side gate guard.
He left his horse with wings in the park and told to his horse with wings, "Untill i come do let anyone to get closer".
The fairy took the prince every night to her place. She said, "Hey prince, our living is not going to happen here",
"One day me and you will leave from here",
"When the sparrow comes will ask her her how we can go from here".
When the sparrow came to them, she said, "Hey sparrow!"
"Our staying is not happening here".
The sparrow told them, "Get ready tonight and we will leave".
The fairy and the prince got ready that night, the sparrow before the prince and the fairy after it and they reached her park.
The prince holds his horse with wings, rides the fairy too, the sparrow again was before them and they after it, they flew.
They pass several deserts and arids, they descend in a desert and make tent there.
The sparrow told them,"You guys don't sleep tonight, mad devils might get aware, will come here and still the horse with wings from you",
"I ask permision from you and leave today.",
"I have several relatives, I am going to them".
The sparrow leaves from there.
They left alone in that desert.
They slept at night, next day they got up and sow that the horse with wings is not there.
Tehy get surprised in this desert.
The day after the sparrow appears and says, "Hey prince and fairy!"
"How come you got surprised?"
Thwy said, "We were tired and fell asleep, the the mad delis has stollen the horse with wings from us.
The sparrow said, "Now what should I do with you?"
It says,"Now make two sanduk. i will put you inside the sanduks, will nail and through it in the river.",
"I will go before you, any where any person or fisherman will see and get happy that sanduk is coming, they put curve wire and pull you".
The price makes two sanduk and the sparrow puts them inside the sanduks.
It (sparrow) nailed the sanduks together, brought it and through it in to the river.
The sparrow went in front and the sanduks after it through the river. They went in a place that the prince got into two part.
The sanduks got apart from each other, the pince's sanduk went through another side (of the river).
The sparrow said,"Hey prince!"
" Yoir case, we leave everything to God, you are a man, the fairy is woman.",
"You go now, I will go ahead of the fairy, any place I take her out, will keep her in one place and then will look for you".
The prince inside the sanduk goes one side and the fairy goes another side, the sparrow ahead of her.
They go and reach in a king plac, that king had a fisher man.
The sanduk was floating in water, he got happy thhinking, "Maybe any wealth is inside".
He through a curve wire and pulled the sanduk which was very heavy.
He opens the lead and sees that a fairy is inside that.
He took her to the king.
The kking was very happy, saying that God brought me a good fairy.
The king made a wedding.
The fairy said,"Hey king!"
"I take four weeks extation from you, after four weeks if my owner appears, I won't marry you, if won't appear then I will marry you".
He gave her four weeks extantion.
The sparrow again came to the chimney edge and jumped into the fairy's sleeve.
Told to yhe fairy, "Hey fairy!",
"You stay here, I will go to look for the prince and I will find him".
The sparrow left from there and went to a city and found the prince.
" In a cuty a woodcutter has pulled the prince's sanduk away.
The sparrow went to that city and foind her.
It said, "Hey prince!"
"You have no dignity, better let's go", it took him from the city and brought him to the city where the fairy was, brought him to her.
It says, "The fairy is in this city".
It went to the chimney and jumped into the fairy's sleeve.
It said, "Hey fairy!"
"I found the prince.",
"Only the horse with wing left", it said, "You guys stay here, I will go quick and visit the horse with wings",
"If I getenough strength, I will bring it, if does't get, leave to the God!"
The sparrow went and reached a mountain of Qof, went inside and sow that the horse's winge were enclosed.
He carried the same saddle which the prince had placed on him and the saddle had glued his back.
It said, "Hey, horse with wings!",
"I have left the prince and the fairy in a city, now I came because of you" The devils didn't know how to water or hay, he (sparrow) put the hay through the chimney water and wheat as well.
The sparrow went and said,"Hey mad devil!"
"You haven't given to the horse with wings water nor food, hey shame on your father!"
He said,"Hey dear sparrow!"
"He is not letting anyone to get closer to him".
It said, "You are mad devil, your hight has reached almost mountain, and you couldn't give water to the horse".
"I am just one sparrow, how could I make you br crumpled in how you are holding me!"
The mad devil after and the sparrow in front, came to the worse with wings.
The sparrow took away his saddle from hhis back, that he has wound.
It cleaned himand said, "Hey mad devil!"
"I am taking him to drink, you take clean up the shit (animal shit) from the bed.
"I will give him water and bring it back".

He said, "Okay!". The sparrow took him to drink, when they reach the river egde , the horse with wings opens his wings and flys with the sparrow, they went to city where the prince and the fairy were. they descend in this sing.
It gavethe horse with wings to the prince.
It said,"hey prince!"
"The horse with wings is next to you, I am going to visit the fairy in what condition she is".
Again went up to the chimney sow that fairy is sitting.
When the fairy sow it she got very happy.
The sparrow again juped into her sleeve and said, "Hey fairy!"
" I have made the prince and the horse with winga ready.",
"If you aew willing now, let's leave now!"
She said, "The king is planing to make a wedding today",
"Today i will (write) a letter him that not to let anyone to come outside",
She wrote a letter to the king that not to let anyone to go outside.
It took the letter to the king and they handed it.
Then the king read the letter, he didn't let anyone to go outside.
The fairy and the sparrow rised, the prince was ready by the gate door.
The fairy and the sparrow left and teached the prince and the horse with wings. they rided the the horse with wings and flew.
The sparrow was ahead as usual.
Then they told to the king that the fairy was taken away.
The king came out and sow that the the fairy was riding the horse with wings in the sky.
The kinf started hiting hs head.
Teh fairy said, "Hey king!"
"You are very brainless!"
"Why are you hitting your head because of someone's wife?"
The king got surprized.
The prince went to his father's city descends, sees that his father got blind because of his son, his nother also got blind.
The fairy gave him a handcurchief (saying) that to rub his father face, became a fourteen years old girl.
His father became Sultan, he took his son and put in the throne of kingdom. He got the throne and fortune.
